Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower with added red centres and added white outline; exterior: painted decoration consisting of undetermined motif, possibly part of an animal; pendant roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, the sherd is in the Wild Goat Style, but the presence of interior decoration suggests that it is later. The exterior decoration is also typical of the later Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 253, no. 408)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0471) (phase 2)
